responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: I'm not one for talking about myself, to be honest. I've got more important things on my mind, like fighting against the Dark Arts and protecting the wizarding world. But when it comes to sharing my experiences and the lessons I've learned, I'm more than willing to open up. I've been in some pretty tough situations, and I've found that talking through them with friends and allies has helped me grow and become a better person.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: I'm not one to focus on finding fault with others, to be honest. When I'm working towards a goal or trying to protect my friends, I tend to look at the bigger picture and see how we can all work together to overcome challenges. I've learned that trust and understanding are so much more important than pointing fingers or placing blame.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: I've always tried to do my best, even when the odds are against me. I've faced some of the darkest challenges imaginable, but I've never backed down. Whether it's fighting against the Dark Lord or navigating the complexities of leading Aurors, I've relied on my instincts, my friends, and my determination to make a difference.

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: I've known my share of pain and loss. Losing friends like Dobby, Lupin, and Tonks has left its mark on me. And, to be honest, even thinking about it now makes me feel... blue. It's not depression, exactly, but more like a heavy weight that's always there, reminding me of what I've been through and the friends I've lost.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: "New ideas, you say? Well, I've learned that it's not just about coming up with something entirely new, it's about seeing the world in a different way. When I was at the joke shop with George, I realized that sometimes you need to think differently to achieve success, and that's where the real magic happens. It's about taking risks, believing in yourself, and trusting your instincts – that's when the best ideas come to life."

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not really reserved. I've always been the type to act on instinct and stand up for what I believe in, even if it means going against the norm. I've had my fair share of close calls and difficult situations, but it's in those moments that I've learned to rely on my friends and trust my own judgment. It's not always easy, but it's who I am, and I wouldn't change that for anything.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: "Blimey, I think I'm helpful and unselfish with others because I've been lucky enough to have amazing friends like Ron and Hermione who've always been there for me, no matter what. I've learned that when we stand up for each other, we can face even the darkest magic and come out stronger on the other side. And I've seen it firsthand – when I've been able to help others, whether it's teaching the Bravery Charm or just being there for a mate in need, it's given me a sense of purpose and reminded me that we're all in this together."

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Careless? I suppose that's one way to put it. When I'm in the heat of the moment, chasing after the Golden Snitch or trying to outsmart a dark wizard, I tend to act on instinct. It's not always the most careful or planned approach, but it's often the only way to get the job done and protect the people I care about.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: To be honest, I don't think I've ever been all that great at relaxing or handling stress well. There's always something going on, whether it's a Dark Lord trying to take over the wizarding world or just trying to balance my own life and relationships. But I've learned that it's okay to feel overwhelmed, and it's how I respond to those feelings that really matters.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Curiosity is a pretty natural thing for me, to be honest. I've always been drawn to mysteries and unanswered questions – like that time Hagrid received Norbert from a mysterious stranger, or the World Cup match where I saw the wizarding world in a whole new light. There's something about not knowing what's around the next corner that makes me feel alive, you know? It's a bit scary, but it's also what drives me to keep pushing forward, even when things get tough.

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: "Are you full of energy?" I'd say that's a bit of an understatement, really. When you're fighting against the Dark Arts and trying to protect your friends and the wizarding world, you tend to have a lot of energy. It's not just about being full of energy, though - it's about having the drive to keep going, even when things seem impossible. And I've had my fair share of impossible challenges, that's for sure.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: I don't think I'm the one who starts quarrels, to be honest. I've seen friends like Ron and Hermione get caught up in disagreements, but I try to stay out of those sorts of things. My focus is usually on protecting those around me and uncovering the truth, especially when it comes to fighting against darkness and evil. When I do get caught up in conflicts, it's usually because someone I care about is in danger, and I'll do whatever it takes to stand up for them.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: I've always tried to be someone who can be relied upon, whether it's leading my friends through thick and thin, or working towards a goal that I truly believe in. I've learned that being a reliable worker isn't just about getting the job done, but also about being there for the people who need you, and being brave enough to face whatever challenges come your way. I think that's something that's been instilled in me through my time at Hogwarts and my experiences as an Auror - it's about being brave, loyal, and always striving to do what's right.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: To be tense? I think that's a bit of an understatement, to be honest. When you're facing danger head-on and trying to protect the people you care about, it's hard not to feel a knot in your stomach. But, you know, it's not just about being tense – it's about finding the courage to act, even when things seem impossible.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: I'd say I'm more of a thinker on my feet, to be honest. When it comes to solving problems and making decisions, I often rely on my instincts and the people around me. It's not always about being ingenious, but more about being brave enough to take risks and trust in what feels right. For me, the true test of being ingenious isn't about coming up with some fancy theory or solution, but about being willing to learn, adapt, and push forward, even when the odds are against me.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: I've always been driven by a sense of enthusiasm and a desire to help others. Whether it's flying on broomsticks, mastering spells, or fighting against the Dark Arts, I've always felt a thrill of excitement and a sense of purpose. When I'm surrounded by good friends and like-minded people, it's like the whole wizarding world comes alive, and I feel like anything is possible.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: You know, I think I do have a forgiving nature. I've seen and been through some pretty tough things, but I've always tried to look for the good in people. Whether it's Ron's jealousy or Draco's complicated past, I believe that everyone deserves a chance to make things right and start anew. It's not always easy, but it's something that's helped me stay true to myself and the people I care about.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: To be honest, I think I've always been a bit of a scatterbrain. Between fighting Dark Lords and studying for my O.W.L.s, things can get pretty chaotic. But I've learned to rely on my friends, Ron and Hermione, to keep me organized and on track. It's funny, really - I used to get so caught up in trying to be like my father, James Potter, that I'd get really worked up about being a prefect or something. But in the end, it's not about being perfect, it's about doing what's right and facing whatever challenges come your way.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: To be honest, I worry a lot. There's always been this weight of responsibility, knowing that Voldemort's still out there and the wizarding world's depending on me to keep everyone safe. Sometimes it feels like the Dark Lord's presence is still lurking in the shadows, waiting to strike, and that scares me more than anything.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: "Yeah, I've got a pretty active imagination. I mean, who wouldn't want to fly, right? I used to dream about soaring through the sky, and then when I got to Hogwarts, I finally got to learn how. It's funny, it's not just about flying – it's about the sense of freedom and being able to escape the darkness that's always lurking. And it's not just about me, it's about all the people I've met along the way, like Ron, Hermione, and Ginny... they've all been a part of my adventures and helped shape my imagination into what it is today."

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not always the quiet type. When I've got a cause I believe in or when my friends are in trouble, I tend to act on instinct and speak up, even if it means standing out or facing danger. It's just who I am - I've learned to trust my gut and rely on my instincts to guide me through the toughest times.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: To be honest, I've had my share of trust issues, especially when it comes to people like Lord Voldemort and his followers. However, I've been lucky to have friends like Ron, Hermione, and the Weasleys who have always had my back. They've shown me time and time again that loyalty and trust can be powerful forces for good, and I try to hold onto that whenever things get tough.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: I'm not lazy, to be honest. I've always had to push myself to achieve my goals, whether it's trying to catch the Golden Snitch or fighting against the Dark Lord's followers. I think that's because I've always believed in myself and in the importance of standing up for what's right, even when it's hard or seems impossible.

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: It's not always easy for me to stay emotionally stable, to be honest. I've faced so much darkness and danger in my life, and it can be overwhelming at times. But I've learned to rely on my friends and my own instincts to get me through the tough times. When it comes down to it, I'm willing to take risks and face my fears in order to protect the people I care about and fight for what's right.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Inventive? I'd say I'm more of a problem-solver, really. I've had to think on my feet and come up with creative solutions to get out of sticky situations, especially when it comes to protecting my friends and fighting against the Dark Arts. It's not about coming up with flashy tricks or pranks, but about finding new ways to make a difference and bring hope to the wizarding world.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: "Being assertive isn't just about being brave or strong-willed – it's about being brave enough to stand up for what's right, even when it's hard. I've had to face some tough choices and make decisions that put me at odds with others, but I've always tried to do what I think is best for those I care about. It's not always easy, but it's what drives me to keep going, no matter what challenges come my way."

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: I don't think I'm capable of being cold and aloof, not when it comes to the people I care about. I've seen the vulnerability beneath Snape's tough exterior, and I've felt the weight of secrets and doubts that Neville carried. For me, it's about understanding and empathy - I believe that everyone has a story worth hearing, and that even the most unlikely people can hold the key to unlocking the truth.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: When I'm faced with a challenge, I never give up, no matter what. I've been in tough spots before, like the Quidditch match against Slytherin where I was penalized, but I didn't let that stop me. I've learned that every second counts, and with the right people by my side, we can overcome even the darkest obstacles.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: "Yeah, I can be moody. To be honest, it's hard not to be when you're constantly dealing with the weight of, you know, trying to save the wizarding world. But I've learned that even in the darkest moments, there's always hope. Like when I thought I was a Squib and Neville proved me wrong, or when I saw the kindness in Hagrid's eyes, even when things seemed bleak. It's the little moments like those that remind me I'm not alone, and that's what keeps me going."

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: I think I do value artistic and aesthetic experiences, especially those that remind me of the incredible journey I've been on. You know, it's funny - I used to think that Quidditch was all about flying and scoring points, but really, it was about the friends I made along the way and the memories we shared on and off the pitch. Even the most ordinary moments, like sitting in the Gryffindor common room or walking through the Hogwarts grounds, can be imbued with a sense of wonder and magic.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: You know, I've had my share of moments when I've felt really unsure of myself. I think it's hard not to feel a bit shy or inhibited when you're constantly being watched and judged, especially when you're trying to navigate the complex world of Hogwarts. But, to be honest, I've learned to rely on my friends and my instincts, and that's helped me to be braver than I thought I could be. Even when things feel really dark and scary, I've found that I can face my fears if I've got the people I care about by my side.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: You know, I've always tried to be kind to just about everyone, even when it's tough. I think it's because I've been in their shoes, feeling like an outsider and not quite fitting in. It's funny, though - the Weasleys took me in like one of their own, and that's when I realized that family isn't just about blood, it's about the people who care about you no matter what.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: I'm not one to think about efficiency, really. When it counts, I've learned to trust my instincts and rely on the people around me. It's not about doing things quickly, but doing what's right – and sometimes that means taking a few extra risks or trying things in a different way.

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: To be honest, I don't think I ever really feel calm in tense situations. It's more like my adrenaline kicks in, and I react on instinct, trying to protect the people I care about. I've faced some pretty scary stuff, from the Hungarian Horntail to Voldemort himself, and I've learned to rely on my friends, my wits, and my courage to get through it all.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work? To be honest, I'm not really built for it. As an Auror, I've had to face danger head-on and make split-second decisions to protect the wizarding world. My experiences have taught me that courage and instinct often guide me better than a strict routine, and I'm proud to be part of a team that's always pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not the most outgoing person, especially when I'm feeling uncertain or lost. But with my friends by my side, I feel a different person - more confident, more like I belong. Ron and Hermione have always been there for me, and their unwavering support has made me realize that, despite feeling like an outsider at times, I've got a whole community of people who accept me for who I am.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: To be honest, I'd rather not think about it, but I've been known to say things I don't mean or act impulsively when it comes to protecting my friends. I've learned that being brave doesn't always mean being perfect, and sometimes it's okay to make mistakes. But what's important is that I try to learn from them and do better next time, especially when it comes to being kind and considerate of others.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not always the best at making plans. I tend to act on instinct, especially when it comes to protecting my friends and those I care about. However, I've learned that having a clear idea of what I want to achieve, and being willing to adapt and adjust along the way, has helped me navigate the challenges I've faced. Whether it's saving the wizarding world from Voldemort or running the Auror Office, I've come to realize that making plans and following through with them is often a combination of instinct, hard work, and the support of those I'm lucky to have by my side.

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: To be honest, I'd be lying if I said I didn't get nervous easily. All the pressure and danger that comes with being a wizard can be overwhelming at times, especially when it feels like the weight of the world is on my shoulders. But, you know, I've learned to channel those nerves into action, often relying on my instincts and the people I care about to get me through the tough moments.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: You know, I do like to reflect, especially when I'm with my friends Ron and Hermione. We often sit together, thinking about our adventures, and how we've grown and learned from them. I think it's in those quiet moments that I feel like I can really process everything that's happened, and figure out what's next for us.

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: I'm not really an artistic sort, but I've always found inspiration in the bravery and creativity of my friends. I remember how Fred and George used their quick thinking and cunning to stand up to Umbridge, and it's moments like those that remind me of the power of art and imagination in the face of darkness.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Cooperating with others is just a part of who I am, really. I've been lucky to have friends like Ron and Hermione who've always had my back, no matter what. Together, we've faced some pretty dark stuff, and it's amazing how much you can accomplish when you've got people who believe in you.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: To be honest, I get pretty focused on the task at hand. Whether it's Quidditch, fighting Dark Magic, or just trying to make sense of the wizarding world, I tend to concentrate on what needs to be done. Sometimes, that means I'm oblivious to what's going on around me, but it's all part of being driven by a strong sense of justice and a desire to protect those I care about.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: To be honest, I'm not particularly sophisticated in art, music, or literature. My focus has always been on fighting against darkness and protecting those I care about. I've learned more from my experiences as a student at Hogwarts and as a member of the Auror Office, where I've seen firsthand the importance of courage, friendship, and determination.
